On 09/10/2007, Kendall Shaw <queshaw@...> wrote:
>
> Hi,
>
>  Am I doing something wrong, or expecting the wrong thing?
>
>  I am using ant 1.7 and junit 4.3.1. I have set haltonfailure="true" on
>  the junit element in my ant script, yet all of my methods annotated with
>  @Test execute even if some fail. Should I be able to have the test suite
>  stop trying after the first failing test?
>

Just checking - they are failing rather than erroring, right?

I think that the ANT JUnit 4 runner is still owned by the ANT guys, so
it might be worth asking on ant-users if you haven't already?

Cheers,

James
